msContents.summary: This text preserves the sale of a donkey at Kerkesoucha in the Arsinoite nome. The donkey is sold by Pnepheros, son of Pnepheros, to Souchas, son of Pnepheros. The price for the donkey was 224 silver drachmas.

condition.ab: This piece of papyrus is almost complete. It is regularly cut at all sides except at the bottom, where the papyrus has broken off; furthermore, the right edge has been cut very close to the last letter of each line. (TC)

handDesc.p: This text is written by three experienced writers. The first hand contributed ll. 1-9 which contains the date, the place, and the word omologei ("swears"). The second hand wrote the body of the contract, using a finer-pointed pen and a more cursive style of writing. The subscription at the end of the text, written by a hypographeus for the seller, is in a hand considerably more rapid and extremely cursive.

div.ab: "The eighteenth year of the Emperor Caesar Titus Aelius Hadrianus Antoninus Augustus Pius, the 5th of the month Xandikos-Mecheir, at Kerkesoucha in the meris of Herakleides of the Arsinoite nome. (2nd hd.) Pnepheros, son of Pnepheros, about 55 years of age, with a scar on the little finger of the left hand, of Kerkesoucha, acknowledges to Souchas, son of Pnepheros, grandson of Petesouchos, about 35 years of age, with a scar on the right eyebrow, that he has sold to him a black female donkey, which has shed its foal-teeth, irrevocably. He has received the price, two hundred twenty-four silver drachmas. The acknowledging party is Neilos.;(3rd hd.) I, Pnepheros, son of Pnepheros, have sold (the donkey), as aforesaid. I, Neilos, have written for him because he does not know letters."
